change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "value of the estate" BEFORE amended by 2004-51-34, effective January 30, 2004 [retro from May 20, 2004 (Royal Assent)].

definition.def: means the gross value, as deposed to in a Statement of Assets, Liabilities and Distribution exhibited to the affidavit leading to a grant or to a resealing, as the case may be, of the real and personal property of the deceased situated in British Columbia that passes to the personal representative at the date of death.

change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "resealing" BEFORE amended by 2009-13-248, effective March 31, 2014 (BC Reg 148/2013).

bcl:definition.bcl:text: resealing means a resealing under the Probate Recognition Act;

change.changenote: Section 2 (1) BEFORE amended by 2010-6-97,Sch 7, effective July 1, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: In addition to any fees payable under the Rules of Court to commence a proceeding to obtain the issue of a grant or a resealing and to any fees payable under the Rules of Court to file documents within that proceeding, a fee determined in accordance with this section must be paid to the government, before the issue of any grant or before any resealing, as the case may be, on behalf of the estate of a deceased by the personal representative of the deceased but is payable by that personal representative in his, her or its representative capacity only.
